title: Rami Malek and Denzel Washington hunt a serial killer on the set of Little Things
text:
He plays a 'supervillain' in forthcoming Bond film No Time To Die.

But after that, Rami Malek will fight on the side of good once more, with the 38-year-old playing a cop on the trail of a serial killer in Little Things.

The 38-year-old was seen with co-star Denzel Washington on the set of the Los Angeles-shot thriller on Monday.

Partners in crime (solving): The 38-year-old was seen with co-star Denzel Washington [R] on the set of the Los Angeles-shot thriller on Monday

Both Oscar-winning thesps donned suits for the street scene, in which their cop characters searched for a serial killer.

Their unseen target was also played by an Academy Award winner: Jared Leto.

According to Variety , the film is about 'a burned-out Kern County, Calif. deputy sheriff named Deke (Washington) who teams with Baxter, a crack LASD detective (Malek), to reel in a wily serial killer'.

The film is directed by John Lee Hancock who is known for his work on The Blind Side and The Highwaymen.

Malek's Bond villain will be a 'nasty piece of work' according to the film's producer.

The Bohemian Rhapsody star will play evil Safin in upcoming espionage blockbuster No Time to Die and producer Barbara Broccoli has claimed the big screen baddie will be more than a match for Daniel Craig's 007.

'We've thrown the book at him on this one. He is really the supervillain. He's the one who really gets under Bond's skin. He's a nasty piece of work,' she told Empire magazine.
